items.content_html: I got to be reminded today just how long VBA takes to run when used inside SQL Queries in Microsoft Access. I wish I could always use SQL Server, which is faster and better in every respect, but in my Company‚Äôs distributed environment, it‚Äôs always Access.

items.title: AirPods batteries drain much faster on phone calls
items.content_html:
I thought my AirPods batteries were already aging out of their useful life span, due to quick draining on numerous hour long phone calls today and last week. It turns out, talk time is only ‚Äúup to 2 hours‚Äù, while listening time (my main use case) is 2 1/2 times that.

Per Apple:

AirPods (single charge): Up to 5 hours listening time,(2) Up to 2 hours talk time(5)

So‚Ä¶phew! I‚Äôm more worried about having to replace them after less than two years due to a battery issue than about shorter battery life on calls.
üéß I had a lot of fun testing out the V-Moda Crossfade 2 headphones last night. My review is on Amazon.

I‚Äôm eagerly awaiting my new V-Moda Crossfade 2‚Äôs to be shipped. I want something that folds up, is durable, and sounds really good. I plan to drive them wired for serious music listening, and wireless for podcasts.

üéµ Frank Turner is‚Äîall at once‚Äîliterate, angry, cynical, hurt, sad, and tender on Love Ire & Song (Well, literate except for comma usage. üòÄ) Despite the negative emotions he expresses, his music is lively and compelling.
I am coding VBA and ripping CDs like it‚Äôs the year 2000 today.

items.title: Git Tower vs. Atlassian SourceTree
items.content_html:
I am enjoying using Tower over Atlassian SourceTree. SourceTree has many, many features, and is free to use, but it has some puzzling bugs that never seem to get fixed. For example, it never deletes branches via Git Flow, not matter how many times I try to reconfigure it.

Tower is faster, works better, and has a clean UI that fits in on the Mac very well. When I emailed Tower support about something, they responded almost instantly. That sold it for me. When the Tower 3 beta expires, I will be purchasing a license.
Coding on my late 2013 15‚Äù MacBook Pro while watching MLB.TV at 60 FPS on the biggest TV in the house is a quite relaxing combo.

üéµ Taking a trip down memory lane with Guster‚Äôs Keep It Together this evening, on my MacBook Pro and Oppo PM-3‚Äôs üéß. Their records are cleanly produced, tightly written, and tastefully played. When I saw them live, though, they absolutely shredded their way through their songs. They were freaking amazing.
I‚Äôm starting to write the import routine I should have written when I first imported the data. Ain‚Äôt that always the way?

This BeoPlay M3 speaker is a better fit in my kitchen than two feet away from me at my office desk. We got a lot of use out of it yesterday, Airplaying from iPhones and our Apple TV. It sounds better when played more loudly, in a larger room.
I‚Äôm feeling pumped for work tomorrow, which is‚Ä¶12 hours too early. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

üìö At long last, I have finished reading Team of Rivals by Doris Kearns Goodwin. It (the last chapter and epilogue especially) has overwhelmed me with a sense of love and sadness, which is why it took me so long to read their whole thing. The book is a monumental achievement.

I am grateful that the grounds crew I hired cleaned up my yard today. The constant noise from their machines is really driving me nuts, though. They are at a house across the street now, so it has been seven hours of power tool noise for me today.

I must be perverse or something, but one of my favorite apps on iOS is Apple‚Äôs Mail app. I tried several alternatives over the years, but Mail caught up to what I need from an email client a few years ago. I like how clean and simple it is, and rely on its unified inbox feature.

I excitedly signed up for the Ulysses 13 beta today. The feature I am most looking forward to is ‚Äúimproved code blocks with syntax highlighting‚Äù. If they provide Swift syntax highlighting in code blocks, I can finally use it for a proper developer‚Äôs log.
I deactivated by Facebook account today. I can‚Äôt muster up the gumption to delete it, and don‚Äôt know why. But it‚Äôs a start.
I‚Äôm trying to catch up to current Red Sox games on MLB At Bat. I‚Äôm still a few days behind. It‚Äôs a losing battle every baseball season, because the games are so long.
Somehow my simple feature update in my app ballooned to a 38-file refactor. üò≥ I‚Äôm in a better position now for a number of additional little updates now, thanks to the the extra work.

The spring cleanup landscaping quotes I got this week have a range of $1,400 for the same work. It really pays to shop around, I guess. Fortunately, my current lawnmowing company put in the lowest quote and can do the work the soonest.
üéµ ‚ÄúSpace Gun‚Äù by Guided by Voices sounds just as good and just as vital as their old stuff.

My current background task, while I work, is secure erasing a bunch of old, small, unneeded hard drives, to prepare them for recycling. I wish I had encrypted them, to avoid all the wait time ahead of me, but that wasn‚Äôt really an option back when I used them.
Sometimes you can program on your hobby projects after work, but sometimes you have to clean house. April is a clean-house kind of month for me.
üéµ I‚Äôm really digging Bleachers‚Äô ‚ÄúGone Now‚Äù right now. I like everything that Jack Antonoff does.
I‚Äôm getting back in the swing of things at work now. I‚Äôm in the groove. Here‚Äôs to a productive week.
